title: Sensory-Motor Activity Design for Neurodiverse Children Using Inclusive Embodied Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of neurodiversity, foundational knowledge of embodied cognition theory, and secondary education methodologies
context.additional_context: Enhancing pre-service teachers' instructional design capabilities for embodied teaching methods through microlearning modules accessible via smartphones

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more educational strategies integrating neurodivergent children's sensorimotor stimulation (stimming) behaviors into the learning process
Learners can present five sensorimotor elements to consider when designing lesson activities based on inclusive embodied pedagogy
Learners can write an application scenario for embodied learning tools (e.g., balance board math games) implementable in mobile environments
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
